availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Caritee Montgomery (Louisville, Kentucky, plasterer and corporal (U.S.A.))

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, plasterer and soldier. Washington County, Kentucky, native. Married to Elizabeth Montgomery. Father of John M. Montgomery. Plasterer in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Plasterer in Louisville in 1861. Plasterer in Louisville in 1863. Served in the 55th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a corporal and private from February 18. 1865, to September 19, 1865. Plasterer in Louisville in 1865.
